breakout adjective [before noun]
(SUCCESSFUL)
mainly US used to describe someone or something that suddenly becomes very well known or successful in a particular type of activity, or an achievement that helps them do this: She was the breakout star of this year's Women's World Cup. This was the breakout book by one of the most original writers of his generation.
More examplesFewer examplesJust a few days before going into bookshops, Time magazine declared it "the breakout fiction debut of the year".Sam Rockwell plays the role in the breakout performance of the year.Carice Van Houten was the breakout star of "Black Book".The drama went on to be the breakout success of the new TV season. He ended the show with his breakout hit Crazy.
